en.value: <p>The LCM and HCF of two numbers are 1485 and 33, respectively. If one of the numbers is divided by 31, the quotient is 9 and the remainder is 18. What is the other number?</p>

pa.value: ਦੋ ਸੰਖਿਆਵਾਂ ਦਾ LCM ਅਤੇ HCF ਕ੍ਰਮਵਾਰ 1485 ਅਤੇ 33 ਹੈ। ਜੇਕਰ ਇੱਕ ਸੰਖਿਆ ਨੂੰ 31 ਨਾਲ ਭਾਗ ਕੀਤਾ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਹੈ, ਤਾਂ ਭਾਗਫਲ 9 ਅਤੇ ਬਾਕੀ 18 ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ। ਦੂਜੀ ਸੰਖਿਆ ਕੀ ਹੈ?

en.comp:
Read the passage carefully and answer the questions that follow:

There are no secrets in science. One can do and know all that a scientist does and knows. One does not need to have any faith in him as an individual and accept what he says without questioning it. The only thing a scientist asks of one is to base ones characterizes a child on whom society has not yet imposed its beliefs and prejudices, In fact, science is nothing more than questions asked and questions answered, and the method of science, no more than a method of asking questions and answering them, a method that "works" and can be used to solve problems that one faces in everyday life.

Science is indeed, far more than just physics, chemistry, biology, astronomy and mathematics. It is a question of ideas and a way of thinking. It is a culture and a philosophy of life, a philosophy which allows us to purpose truth without any prejudgement. What, then, is this attitude of mind, this culture and this philosophy of life? It turns out that all these- and other-concomitants and attributes of science emanate primarily from the method that science uses to acquire knowledge. Certain characteristics of this method, which we call "The method of science", and of knowledge gained by the application of this method, create a value system within their framework, a value system which is rational and reasonable, which appeals to common sense, which is commensurate with knowledge and, above all which has a build-in corrective. It, therefore, becomes especially important to understand the basis of the method of science, and at the value system of science, so that we may understand the culture. One does not need to have any faith in him as an individual and accept what he says without questioning it.

Read the stanza given below and answer the questions/complete the statements that follow with the help of given options.

My mistress bent that brow of hers;

Those deep dark eyes where pride demurs

When pity would be softening though,

Fixed me a breathing while or twos

With life or death in the balance right !

The blood replenished me again;

My last thought was at least not vain :

I and my mistress, side by side

Shall be together, breathe and ride,

So, one day more am I deified,

Who knows next but the world may end to-night?

en.value: <p>A teacher organizes her class into the pair and gives a story of 18 sentences. One of the pairs has odd sentences (sentence 1, 3, 5,....) printed and other sentences blank while the other has even sentences (sentences 2, 4, 6,.....) and odd sentences blanks. Students in pairs have to read out the sentences mutually to each other and write to complete the story. This involves listening, speaking, reading and writing. What is this task known as?</p>
How can school/college help youth to choose the right career?
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions complete the statement that follow by choosing the correct options from the given ones.

Today's youth want name, fame and affluence without outing in required efforts. They run after jobs and expect high salaries. They are not willing to start a small business of their own. They can argue that it requires money. But banks are ready to fund their projects. The other argument can be that it require practical knowledge. But one can work part - time or as an intern to some firm in order to gain practical knowledge. Government also provides training to the entrepreneurs willing to start their own business. One's own business can range from a grocery shop, a coaching centre, a computer institute, or so. Success of the venture very much depends on entrepreneur's ability, hard work, dedication and grit. So, One should not wait for an ideal job, rather think of starting his/her own business. One has to climb the steps slowly and steadily to reach the apex. It may help them to load a stable and normal life and acquire a good carrier. We can also reduce unemployment by self - employment. The youth should be job creator rather than job seeker. Parents and teachers should jointly own responsibility of children. Parents should be aware of their children's needs. They should gather information about the various areas that their children can venture into. Schools and colleges should invite the counsellors and professionals to guide the students. They can help them in choosing the right career. Future of the country lies in the hands of the youth. Their betterment would be tantamount to the betterment of the county ads a whole.

options.value: School/College may guide parents about their children&#39;s needs.
School/College should invite counsellors and professionals to guide the students.
School/Colleges should provide information to students about various areas
School/College may encourage students to get computer literate

So, One should not wait for an ideal job, rather think of starting his/her own business. One has to climb the steps slowly and steadily to reach the apex. It may help them to load a stable and normal life and acquire a good carrier. We can also reduce unemployment by self - employment. The youth should be job creator rather than job seeker. Parents and teachers should jointly own responsibility of children. Parents should be aware of their children's needs. They should gather information about the various areas that their children can venture into. Schools and colleges should invite the counsellors and professionals to guide the students. They can help them in choosing the right career. Future of the country lies in the hands of the youth. Their betterment would be tantamount to the betterment of the county ads a whole.

en.value: The word &#39;hydrated&#39; in the passage means
en.comp:
As the nip in the air gets sharper, your skin is likely to lose its moisture and become dry and dull. Do not worry. All you need is a little tweaking of your skincare regimen to keep it hydrated, "your skin indicates changes in temperature early on. You should not wait for the winters to set in, Instead, start preparing from the moment you experience a change in weather", says Mumbai based dermatologist Dr Parikh. While those with dry skin are among the worst affected, people with oily or combination skins may find their skin looking dull and patchy.

A change in weather calls for a revamp of your skincare routine. "You need to shift to creamier, hydrating products and those that are gentler on your skin. So, When you buy a face - wash for winter, pick one that cleanses but does not strip the skin of its natural oils. Avoid face washes with harsh acids and peroxides", advises Dr Rashmi Shetty. When it comes to face creams look fir ingredients like vitamin E, natural oils, soothing flower extracts and pep that repair and stimulate your skin. Avoid alcohol or clay - based products, all of which have a drying effect.

Of course you know moisturizing is key when it comes to fighting winter skin woes. No matter which cream you choose, apply it multiple times during the day and night. Additionally, massage your body with warm oil five minutes before a bath.

Mother tongue, English, state language, Sanskrit, Pali, Prakrit and tribal and minor languages
English as medium of instruction across schooling.
Mother tongue / Home language, classical languages, modern Indian languages and foreign languages

en.value: A children of eight years from Bihar moves to Mumbai along with her parents and she learns Hindi, Sanskrit and English in school and learnt the language of Marathi very well from her neighbourhood and her friends in school. What would you describe the learning of Marathi?&nbsp;&nbsp;
While reading a text a learner get some prompts that supports the meaning - making process. What is this known as?
Which process of listening involves getting the main idea, predicting, drawing inferences and summarizing?
Nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs are categorized as _______.
Knowledge about the form, describing and applying it in limited practice is _______
&#39;Origin of the text from context in natural language&#39; is _______.

options.value: a text developed by textbook writers

en.value: Which of the following are true of language assessment?

options.value: Assessing the grammatical knowledge of learners.
Assessing the language proficiency of learners.
To find what learners do not know

en.value: Which of the following are&nbsp;<u>true</u>&nbsp;of errors in language classroom?

options.value: Errors are learning areas and feedback for both learners and the teacher.&nbsp;
Errors are to be corrected then and there as learners use language.
Errors are learning areas for the teacher only.
Error is an indication of interference of first language in the second language.

en.value: A language teachers along with her social science colleague gives an assignment on &#39;Cultural diversity of India&#39;. Learners are to consult social science books and other books and documents relating to History, Geography, Culture and Politics to write a report and develop a poster on the theme. What would this process of language learning called?

A learner while learning the new grammatical form (say, future perfect - will have + past participle) is able to connect what he has already learnt (the present perfect form - has + past participle). What would this learning strategy be called?

A learner is able to read a text with limited understanding. She is able to read the text very well and do the comprehension tasks with the support of her elder brother. This practice of learning - teaching _______.
A task which supports learners to connect form, meaning and use is _______.

options.value: language learning tasks for meaning making

en.value: Which of the following is &#39;consciousness raising&#39; strategy in grammar learning?

options.value: Present grammatical item as form and practice many a time to use it later in isolation.
Present the grammar/language item in context, enable learners to notice and use it and later draw their attention to its form.
Present the grammatical rules from a grammar book / or from a work book and give exercises to solve by learners.
Grammatical item is presented in a text or narrative and learnt through drills.

en.value: Constructivism as a learning theory believes that ______

options.value: children learn new knowledge through classroom teaching.&nbsp;
language is learnt through structured practice.
all learners learn in the same manner.
children learn by connecting with their previous knowledge.
